text: XII .
text_tokenized: XII .

text: In consequence of an agreement between the sisters , Elizabeth wrote the next morning to her mother , to beg that the carriage might be sent for them in the course of the day .
text_tokenized: In consequence of an agreement between the sisters , Elizabeth wrote the next morning to her mother , to beg that the carriage might be sent for them in the course of the day .

text: But Mrs. Bennet , who had calculated on her daughters remaining at Netherfield till the following Tuesday , which would exactly finish Jane ’s week , could not bring herself to receive them with pleasure before .
text_tokenized: But Mrs. Bennet , who had calculated on her daughters remaining at Netherfield till the following Tuesday , which would exactly finish Jane ’s week , could not bring herself to receive them with pleasure before .

text: Her answer , therefore , was not propitious , at least not to Elizabeth ’s wishes , for she was impatient to get home .
text_tokenized: Her answer , therefore , was not propitious , at least not to Elizabeth ’s wishes , for she was impatient to get home .

text: Mrs. Bennet sent them word that they could not possibly have the carriage before Tuesday ; and in her postscript it was added , that if Mr. Bingley and his sister pressed them to stay longer , she could spare them very well .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet sent them word that they could not possibly have the carriage before Tuesday ; and in her postscript it was added , that if Mr. Bingley and his sister pressed them to stay longer , she could spare them very well .

text: Against staying longer , however , Elizabeth was positively resolved -- nor did she much expect it would be asked ; and fearful , on the contrary , of being considered as intruding themselves needlessly long , she urged Jane to borrow Mr. Bingley ’s carriage immediately , and
text_tokenized: Against staying longer , however , Elizabeth was positively resolved -- nor did she much expect it would be asked ; and fearful , on the contrary , of being considered as intruding themselves needlessly long , she urged Jane to borrow Mr. Bingley ’s carriage immediately , and

text: at length it was settled that their original design of leaving Netherfield that morning should be mentioned , and the request made .
text_tokenized: at length it was settled that their original design of leaving Netherfield that morning should be mentioned , and the request made .

text: The communication excited many professions of concern ; and enough was said of wishing them to stay at least till the following day to work on Jane ; and till the morrow their going was deferred .
text_tokenized: The communication excited many professions of concern ; and enough was said of wishing them to stay at least till the following day to work on Jane ; and till the morrow their going was deferred .

text: Miss Bingley was then sorry that she had proposed the delay ; for her jealousy and dislike of one sister much exceeded her affection for the other .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley was then sorry that she had proposed the delay ; for her jealousy and dislike of one sister much exceeded her affection for the other .

text: The master of the house heard with real sorrow that they were to go so soon , and repeatedly tried to persuade Miss Bennet that it would not be safe for her -- that she was not enough recovered ; but Jane was firm where she felt herself to be right .
text_tokenized: The master of the house heard with real sorrow that they were to go so soon , and repeatedly tried to persuade Miss Bennet that it would not be safe for her -- that she was not enough recovered ; but Jane was firm where she felt herself to be right .

text: To Mr. Darcy it was welcome intelligence : Elizabeth had been at Netherfield long enough .
text_tokenized: To Mr. Darcy it was welcome intelligence : Elizabeth had been at Netherfield long enough .

text: She attracted him more than he liked ; and Miss Bingley was uncivil to _ her _ and more teasing than usual to himself .
text_tokenized: She attracted him more than he liked ; and Miss Bingley was uncivil to _ her _ and more teasing than usual to himself .

text_tokenized: He

text: wisely resolved to be particularly careful that no sign of admiration should _ now _ escape him -- nothing that could elevate her with the hope of influencing his felicity ; sensible that , if such an idea had been suggested , his behaviour during the last day must have material weight in confirming or crushing it .
text_tokenized: wisely resolved to be particularly careful that no sign of admiration should _ now _ escape him -- nothing that could elevate her with the hope of influencing his felicity ; sensible that , if such an idea had been suggested , his behaviour during the last day must have material weight in confirming or crushing it .

text: Steady to his purpose , he scarcely spoke ten words to her through the whole of Saturday : and though they were at one time left by themselves for half an hour , he adhered most conscientiously to his book , and would not even look at her .
text_tokenized: Steady to his purpose , he scarcely spoke ten words to her through the whole of Saturday : and though they were at one time left by themselves for half an hour , he adhered most conscientiously to his book , and would not even look at her .

text: On Sunday , after morning service , the separation , so agreeable to almost all , took place .
text_tokenized: On Sunday , after morning service , the separation , so agreeable to almost all , took place .

text: Miss Bingley ’s civility to Elizabeth increased at last very rapidly , as well as her affection for Jane ; and when they parted , after assuring the latter of the pleasure it would always give her to see her either at Longbourn or Netherfield , and embracing her most tenderly , she even shook hands with the former .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley ’s civility to Elizabeth increased at last very rapidly , as well as her affection for Jane ; and when they parted , after assuring the latter of the pleasure it would always give her to see her either at Longbourn or Netherfield , and embracing her most tenderly , she even shook hands with the former .

text: Elizabeth took leave of the whole party in the liveliest spirits .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth took leave of the whole party in the liveliest spirits .

text: They were not welcomed home very cordially by their mother .
text_tokenized: They were not welcomed home very cordially by their mother .

text: Mrs. Bennet wondered at their coming , and thought them very wrong to give so much trouble , and was sure Jane would have caught cold again .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet wondered at their coming , and thought them very wrong to give so much trouble , and was sure Jane would have caught cold again .

text: But their father , though very laconic in his expressions of pleasure , was really glad to see them ; he had felt their importance in the family circle .
text_tokenized: But their father , though very laconic in his expressions of pleasure , was really glad to see them ; he had felt their importance in the family circle .

text: The evening conversation , when they were all assembled , had lost much of its animation , and almost all its sense , by the absence of Jane and Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: The evening conversation , when they were all assembled , had lost much of its animation , and almost all its sense , by the absence of Jane and Elizabeth .

text: They found Mary , as usual , deep in the study of thorough bass and human nature ; and had some new extracts to admire and some new observations of threadbare morality to listen to .
text_tokenized: They found Mary , as usual , deep in the study of thorough bass and human nature ; and had some new extracts to admire and some new observations of threadbare morality to listen to .

text: Catherine and Lydia had information for them of a different sort .
text_tokenized: Catherine and Lydia had information for them of a different sort .

text: Much had been done , and much had been said in the regiment since the preceding Wednesday ; several of the officers had dined lately with their uncle ; a private had been flogged ; and it had actually been hinted that Colonel Forster was going to be married
text_tokenized: Much had been done , and much had been said in the regiment since the preceding Wednesday ; several of the officers had dined lately with their uncle ; a private had been flogged ; and it had actually been hinted that Colonel Forster was going to be married

text: XIII “ I hope , my dear , ” said Mr. Bennet to his wife , as they were at breakfast the next morning , “ that you have ordered a good dinner to - day , because I have reason to expect an addition to our family party . ”
text_tokenized: XIII “ I hope , my dear , ” said Mr. Bennet to his wife , as they were at breakfast the next morning , “ that you have ordered a good dinner to - day , because I have reason to expect an addition to our family party . ”

text: “ Who do you mean , my dear ?
text_tokenized: “ Who do you mean , my dear ?

text: I know of nobody that is coming , I am sure , unless Charlotte Lucas should happen to call in ; and I hope _ my _ dinners are good enough for her .
text_tokenized: I know of nobody that is coming , I am sure , unless Charlotte Lucas should happen to call in ; and I hope _ my _ dinners are good enough for her .

text: I do not believe she often sees such at home . ” “ The person of whom I speak is a gentleman and a stranger . ” Mrs. Bennet ’s eyes sparkled .
text_tokenized: I do not believe she often sees such at home . ” “ The person of whom I speak is a gentleman and a stranger . ” Mrs. Bennet ’s eyes sparkled .

text: “ A gentleman and a stranger !
text_tokenized: “ A gentleman and a stranger !

text: It is Mr. Bingley , I am sure .
text_tokenized: It is Mr. Bingley , I am sure .

text: Why , Jane -- you never dropped a word of this -- you sly thing !
text_tokenized: Why , Jane -- you never dropped a word of this -- you sly thing !

text: Well , I am sure I shall be extremely glad to see Mr. Bingley .
text_tokenized: Well , I am sure I shall be extremely glad to see Mr. Bingley .

text: But -- good Lord !
text_tokenized: But -- good Lord !

text: how unlucky !
text_tokenized: how unlucky !

text: there is not a bit of fish to be got to - day .
text_tokenized: there is not a bit of fish to be got to - day .

text: Lydia , my love , ring the bell .
text_tokenized: Lydia , my love , ring the bell .

text: I must speak to Hill this moment .
text_tokenized: I must speak to Hill this moment .

text: ” “ It is _ not _ Mr. Bingley , ” said her husband ; “ it is a person whom I never saw in the whole course of my life . ” This roused a general astonishment ; and he had the pleasure of being eagerly questioned by his wife and five daughters at once .
text_tokenized: ” “ It is _ not _ Mr. Bingley , ” said her husband ; “ it is a person whom I never saw in the whole course of my life . ” This roused a general astonishment ; and he had the pleasure of being eagerly questioned by his wife and five daughters at once .

text: After amusing himself some time with their curiosity , he thus explained:--“About a month ago I received this letter , and about a fortnight ago I answered it ; for I thought it a case of some delicacy , and requiring early attention .
text_tokenized: After amusing himself some time with their curiosity , he thus explained:--“About a month ago I received this letter , and about a fortnight ago I answered it ; for I thought it a case of some delicacy , and requiring early attention .

text: It is from my cousin , Mr. Collins , who , when I am dead , may turn you all out of this house as soon as he pleases . ”
text_tokenized: It is from my cousin , Mr. Collins , who , when I am dead , may turn you all out of this house as soon as he pleases . ”

text: “ Oh , my dear , ” cried his wife , “ I can not bear to hear that mentioned .
text_tokenized: “ Oh , my dear , ” cried his wife , “ I can not bear to hear that mentioned .

text: Pray do not talk of that odious man .
text_tokenized: Pray do not talk of that odious man .

text: I do think it is the hardest thing in the world , that your estate should be entailed away from your own children ; and I am sure , if I had been you , I should have tried long ago to do something or other about it . ”
text_tokenized: I do think it is the hardest thing in the world , that your estate should be entailed away from your own children ; and I am sure , if I had been you , I should have tried long ago to do something or other about it . ”

text: Jane and Elizabeth attempted to explain to her the nature of an entail .
text_tokenized: Jane and Elizabeth attempted to explain to her the nature of an entail .

text: They had often attempted it before : but it was a subject on which Mrs. Bennet was beyond the reach of reason ; and she continued to rail bitterly against the cruelty of settling an estate away from a family of five daughters , in favour of a man whom nobody cared anything about .
text_tokenized: They had often attempted it before : but it was a subject on which Mrs. Bennet was beyond the reach of reason ; and she continued to rail bitterly against the cruelty of settling an estate away from a family of five daughters , in favour of a man whom nobody cared anything about .

text: “ It certainly is a most iniquitous affair , ” said Mr. Bennet ; “ and nothing can clear Mr. Collins from the guilt of inheriting Longbourn . But if you will listen to his letter , you may , perhaps , be a little softened by his manner of expressing himself . ” “ No , that I am sure I shall not : and I think it was very impertinent of him to write to you at all , and very hypocritical .
text_tokenized: “ It certainly is a most iniquitous affair , ” said Mr. Bennet ; “ and nothing can clear Mr. Collins from the guilt of inheriting Longbourn . But if you will listen to his letter , you may , perhaps , be a little softened by his manner of expressing himself . ” “ No , that I am sure I shall not : and I think it was very impertinent of him to write to you at all , and very hypocritical .

text: I hate such false friends .
text_tokenized: I hate such false friends .

text: Why could not he keep on quarrelling with you , as his father did before him ? ” “ Why , indeed , he does seem to have had some filial scruples on that head , as you will hear . ” / * RIGHT “ Hunsford , near Westerham , Kent , _ 15th October _ .
text_tokenized: Why could not he keep on quarrelling with you , as his father did before him ? ” “ Why , indeed , he does seem to have had some filial scruples on that head , as you will hear . ” / * RIGHT “ Hunsford , near Westerham , Kent , _ 15th October _ .

text: / “ Dear Sir , “ The disagreement subsisting between yourself and my late honoured father always gave me much uneasiness ; and , since I have had the misfortune to lose him , I have frequently wished to heal the breach :
text_tokenized: / “ Dear Sir , “ The disagreement subsisting between yourself and my late honoured father always gave me much uneasiness ; and , since I have had the misfortune to lose him , I have frequently wished to heal the breach :

text: but , for some time , I was kept back by my own doubts , fearing lest it might seem disrespectful to his memory for me to be on good terms with anyone with whom it had always pleased him to be at variance . ”--‘There , Mrs. Bennet . ’--“My mind , however , is now made up on the subject ; for , having received ordination at Easter , I have been so fortunate as to be distinguished by the patronage of the Right Honourable Lady Catherine de Bourgh , widow of Sir Lewis de Bourgh , whose bounty and beneficence has preferred me to the valuable rectory of this parish , where it shall be my earnest endeavour to demean myself with grateful respect towards her Ladyship , and be ever ready to perform those rites and ceremonies which are instituted by the Church of England . As a clergyman , moreover , I feel it my duty to promote and establish the blessing of peace in all families within the reach of my influence ; and on these grounds I flatter myself that my present overtures of good - will are highly commendable , and that the circumstance of my being next in the entail of Longbourn estate will be kindly overlooked on your side , and not lead you to reject the offered olive branch .
text_tokenized: but , for some time , I was kept back by my own doubts , fearing lest it might seem disrespectful to his memory for me to be on good terms with anyone with whom it had always pleased him to be at variance . ”--‘There , Mrs. Bennet . ’--“My mind , however , is now made up on the subject ; for , having received ordination at Easter , I have been so fortunate as to be distinguished by the patronage of the Right Honourable Lady Catherine de Bourgh , widow of Sir Lewis de Bourgh , whose bounty and beneficence has preferred me to the valuable rectory of this parish , where it shall be my earnest endeavour to demean myself with grateful respect towards her Ladyship , and be ever ready to perform those rites and ceremonies which are instituted by the Church of England . As a clergyman , moreover , I feel it my duty to promote and establish the blessing of peace in all families within the reach of my influence ; and on these grounds I flatter myself that my present overtures of good - will are highly commendable , and that the circumstance of my being next in the entail of Longbourn estate will be kindly overlooked on your side , and not lead you to reject the offered olive branch .

text: I can not be otherwise than concerned at being the means of injuring your amiable daughters , and beg leave to apologize for it , as well as to assure you of my readiness to make them every possible amends ; but of this hereafter .
text_tokenized: I can not be otherwise than concerned at being the means of injuring your amiable daughters , and beg leave to apologize for it , as well as to assure you of my readiness to make them every possible amends ; but of this hereafter .

text: If you should have no objection to receive me into your house , I propose myself the satisfaction of waiting on you and your family , Monday , November 18th , by four o’clock , and shall probably trespass on your hospitality till the Saturday se’nnight following , which I can do without any inconvenience , as Lady Catherine is far from objecting to my occasional absence on a Sunday , provided that some other clergyman is engaged to do the duty of the day .
text_tokenized: If you should have no objection to receive me into your house , I propose myself the satisfaction of waiting on you and your family , Monday , November 18th , by four o’clock , and shall probably trespass on your hospitality till the Saturday se’nnight following , which I can do without any inconvenience , as Lady Catherine is far from objecting to my occasional absence on a Sunday , provided that some other clergyman is engaged to do the duty of the day .

text: I remain , dear sir , with respectful compliments to your lady and daughters , your well - wisher and friend , “ WILLIAM COLLINS . ”
text_tokenized: I remain , dear sir , with respectful compliments to your lady and daughters , your well - wisher and friend , “ WILLIAM COLLINS . ”

text: “ At four o’clock , therefore , we may expect this peace - making gentleman , ” said Mr. Bennet , as he folded up the letter .
text_tokenized: “ At four o’clock , therefore , we may expect this peace - making gentleman , ” said Mr. Bennet , as he folded up the letter .

text: “ He seems to be a most conscientious and polite young man , upon my word ; and , I doubt not , will prove a valuable acquaintance , especially if Lady Catherine should be so indulgent as to let him come to us again . ”
text_tokenized: “ He seems to be a most conscientious and polite young man , upon my word ; and , I doubt not , will prove a valuable acquaintance , especially if Lady Catherine should be so indulgent as to let him come to us again . ”

text: “ There is some sense in what he says about the girls , however ; and , if he is disposed to make them any amends , I shall not be the person to discourage him . ”
text_tokenized: “ There is some sense in what he says about the girls , however ; and , if he is disposed to make them any amends , I shall not be the person to discourage him . ”

text: “ Though it is difficult , ” said Jane , “ to guess in what way he can mean to make us the atonement he thinks our due , the wish is certainly to his credit . ”
text_tokenized: “ Though it is difficult , ” said Jane , “ to guess in what way he can mean to make us the atonement he thinks our due , the wish is certainly to his credit . ”

text: Elizabeth was chiefly struck with his extraordinary deference for Lady Catherine , and his kind intention of christening , marrying , and burying his parishioners whenever it were required .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was chiefly struck with his extraordinary deference for Lady Catherine , and his kind intention of christening , marrying , and burying his parishioners whenever it were required .

text_tokenized: “ He must be an oddity , I think , ” said she .

text_tokenized: “ I can not make him out .

text_tokenized: is something very pompous in his style .

text: And what can he mean by apologizing for being next in the entail ?
text_tokenized: And what can he mean by apologizing for being next in the entail ?

text: Can he be a sensible man , sir ? ”
text_tokenized: Can he be a sensible man , sir ? ”

text: “ No , my dear ; I think not .
text_tokenized: “ No , my dear ; I think not .

text: I have great hopes of finding him quite the reverse .
text_tokenized: I have great hopes of finding him quite the reverse .

text_tokenized: “ In point of composition , ” said Mary , “ his letter does not seem defective .

text: The idea of the olive branch perhaps is not wholly new , yet I think it is well expressed .
text_tokenized: The idea of the olive branch perhaps is not wholly new , yet I think it is well expressed .

text: To Catherine and Lydia neither the letter nor its writer were in any degree interesting .
text_tokenized: To Catherine and Lydia neither the letter nor its writer were in any degree interesting .

text: It was next to impossible that their cousin should come in a scarlet coat , and it was now some weeks since they had received pleasure from the society of a man in any other colour .
text_tokenized: It was next to impossible that their cousin should come in a scarlet coat , and it was now some weeks since they had received pleasure from the society of a man in any other colour .

text: As for their mother , Mr. Collins ’s letter had done away much of her ill - will , and she was preparing to see him with a degree of composure which astonished her husband and daughters .
text_tokenized: As for their mother , Mr. Collins ’s letter had done away much of her ill - will , and she was preparing to see him with a degree of composure which astonished her husband and daughters .

text: Mr. Collins was punctual to his time , and was received with great politeness by the whole family .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins was punctual to his time , and was received with great politeness by the whole family .

text: Mr. Bennet indeed said little ; but the ladies were ready enough to talk , and Mr. Collins seemed neither in need of encouragement , nor inclined to be silent himself .
text_tokenized: Mr. Bennet indeed said little ; but the ladies were ready enough to talk , and Mr. Collins seemed neither in need of encouragement , nor inclined to be silent himself .

text: He was a tall , heavy - looking young man of five - and - twenty .
text_tokenized: He was a tall , heavy - looking young man of five - and - twenty .

text: His air was grave and stately , and his manners were very formal .
text_tokenized: His air was grave and stately , and his manners were very formal .

text: He had not been long seated before he complimented Mrs. Bennet on having so fine a family of daughters , said he had heard much of their beauty , but that , in this instance , fame had fallen short of the truth ; and added , that he did not doubt her seeing them all in due time well disposed of in marriage .
text_tokenized: He had not been long seated before he complimented Mrs. Bennet on having so fine a family of daughters , said he had heard much of their beauty , but that , in this instance , fame had fallen short of the truth ; and added , that he did not doubt her seeing them all in due time well disposed of in marriage .

text: This gallantry was not much to the taste of some of his hearers ; but Mrs. Bennet , who quarrelled with no compliments , answered most readily,-- “ You are very kind , sir , I am sure ; and I wish with all my heart it may prove so ; for else they will be destitute enough .
text_tokenized: This gallantry was not much to the taste of some of his hearers ; but Mrs. Bennet , who quarrelled with no compliments , answered most readily,-- “ You are very kind , sir , I am sure ; and I wish with all my heart it may prove so ; for else they will be destitute enough .

text: Things are settled so oddly . ”
text_tokenized: Things are settled so oddly . ”

text: “ You allude , perhaps , to the entail of this estate . ”
text_tokenized: “ You allude , perhaps , to the entail of this estate . ”

text: “ Ah , sir , I do indeed .
text_tokenized: “ Ah , sir , I do indeed .

text: It is a grievous affair to my poor girls , you must confess .
text_tokenized: It is a grievous affair to my poor girls , you must confess .

text: Not that I mean to find fault with _ you _ , for such things , I know , are all chance in this world .
text_tokenized: Not that I mean to find fault with _ you _ , for such things , I know , are all chance in this world .

text: There is no knowing how estates will go when once they come to be entailed .
text_tokenized: There is no knowing how estates will go when once they come to be entailed .

text: “ I am very sensible , madam , of the hardship to my fair cousins , and could say much on the subject , but that I am cautious of appearing forward and precipitate .
text_tokenized: “ I am very sensible , madam , of the hardship to my fair cousins , and could say much on the subject , but that I am cautious of appearing forward and precipitate .

text: But I can assure the young ladies that I come prepared to admire them .
text_tokenized: But I can assure the young ladies that I come prepared to admire them .

text: At present I will not say more , but , perhaps , when we are better acquainted---- ” He was interrupted by a summons to dinner ; and the girls smiled on each other .
text_tokenized: At present I will not say more , but , perhaps , when we are better acquainted---- ” He was interrupted by a summons to dinner ; and the girls smiled on each other .

text: They were not the only objects of Mr. Collins ’s admiration .
text_tokenized: They were not the only objects of Mr. Collins ’s admiration .

text: The hall , the dining - room , and all its furniture , were examined and praised ; and his commendation of everything would have touched Mrs. Bennet ’s heart , but for the mortifying supposition of his viewing it all as his own future property .
text_tokenized: The hall , the dining - room , and all its furniture , were examined and praised ; and his commendation of everything would have touched Mrs. Bennet ’s heart , but for the mortifying supposition of his viewing it all as his own future property .

text: The dinner , too , in its turn , was highly admired ;
text_tokenized: The dinner , too , in its turn , was highly admired ;

text: and he begged to know to which of his fair cousins the excellence of its cookery was owing .
text_tokenized: and he begged to know to which of his fair cousins the excellence of its cookery was owing .

text: But here he was set right by Mrs. Bennet , who assured him , with some asperity , that they were very well able to keep a good cook , and that her daughters had nothing to do in the kitchen .
text_tokenized: But here he was set right by Mrs. Bennet , who assured him , with some asperity , that they were very well able to keep a good cook , and that her daughters had nothing to do in the kitchen .

text: He begged pardon for having displeased her .
text_tokenized: He begged pardon for having displeased her .

text: In a softened tone she declared herself not at all offended ; but he continued to apologize for about a quarter of an hour .
